alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Ellis; Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Ellis, south central Woods, northwestern Dewey, northwestern Major and Woodward Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 859 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mooreland to near Arnett. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodward, Arnett, Mooreland, Vici, Sharon, Mutual, Alabaster Caverns State Park, Harmon, Quinlan, Tangier, and Bouse Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
